Memories.0: The absolute beauty of the park is what impressed me. I have been to many parts of the world, but the sheer diversity of the attractions within Yellowstone is hard to beat. -Doug
Memories.2: Driving around Yellowstone and having to stop for the buffalo who were walking in the middle of the road -Morgan
Memories.3: Picnic lunches and the river each day watching all the cousins play -Dana
Memories.5: I loved the algae stained pools of hot water and the numerous animals we encountered. -Grandpa
Memories.6: I loved the picnics we had each day in different parts of the park that led to playing in snow, water, and meadows. -Grammy
Memories.7: The amazing thing about Yellowstone is everything is accessible from your car -Doug
Memories.8: I would love to go back and really spend some time there hiking, camping, and fishing -Doug
Memories.10: Grammy holding me at the falls -Reese
Memories.11: The kids putting on a spa and massages by the full sized Grizzly Bear -Lonni

Memories.0: The chance to spend a week in a large beach house right on the beach in Mexico is a once in a lifetime opportunity. -Doug
Memories.1: Feeding raw chicken to alligators on our boat ride was scary but fun -Doug
Memories.2: Releasing baby sea turtles into the ocean at dusk, then running back to the beach house getting attacked by mosquitoes -Katie
Memories.3: Falling asleep and waking up to the sound of waves breaking -Dana
Memories.4: Boogie boarding in the ocean. I was the boogie board queen -Morgan
Memories.5: I loved the virgin Pina Colada drinks with their coconut taste. -Grandpa
Memories.6: Seeing the turtle nest near our place and then going down and helping the little turtle hatchlings get to the ocean-- in spite of the mosquitos. -Grammy
Memories.7: We got to body surf, see the sea turtles hatch and return to the ocean, and even survived a hurricane that passed us by just off shore -Doug
Memories.8: This was the most relaxing vacation ever. We just ate, slept, played in the ocean, and sat on the beach. What could be better than that? -Doug

Memories.0: Spending the 4th of July in Telluride was great. -Doug
Memories.1: Looking out the window one morning and seeing a chipmunk going to town on a cantaloupe -Morgan
Memories.2: Hiking down under the waterfall was amazing -Katie
Memories.3: Riding the gondola down the mountain from our cabin into Telluride. -Dana
Memories.5: The huge size of the white-bark quaking asp trees, the deer grazing outside the window and the gondola rides over the mountains. -Grandpa
Memories.6: Telluride is in a valley surrounded by very high mountains. The fiesworks for 4th of July reverberated off the side of the mountains to really add to the sight of the fireworks themselves -Doug
Memories.7: Taking family pictures in this beautiful country, having our total family together, and enjoying the setting of the place in the woods where we saw deer and other beauties of nature. -Grammy
Memories.8: We rented a super nice multi-million dollar cabin up in the mountains -Doug
Memories.9: To get to town, we were picked up by a car service and taken to the ski gondola. It was a 20 min ride to town over some very beautiful terrain -Doug
Memories.10: watching the fireworks shoot over the valley that felt like they were right on top of us -Lonni
Memories.11: Gondalas had beautiful views, panning for gold, and exploring caves -Reese
Memories.12: Hot tubing, fishing, and 4th of July -Reese
Memories.13: I loved the location, our house/cabin was beautiful, especially over 4th of July -Byron
Memories.14: We went shopping with Grammy and came back with knives! -Greer

Memories.0: I grew up as a kid loving Starky. -Doug
Memories.1: Marshmellow gun wars and playing shipwreck -Morgan
Memories.2: Catching crayfish then cooking and eating them -Katie
Memories.3: Placing rocks to form a natural hot spring pool along the side of the river -Dana
Memories.4: Four wheeling rides to the rim of Hells Canyon -Doug
Memories.5: Convergence of the hot and cold water in the creek. -Grandpa
Memories.6: Beginning a wonderful tradition of holding Crayton & Elva Leavitt Reunions every other year; we began with a heritage theme including pictures, memories, games and stories of great-greats, greats, and grands grandparents. -Grammy
Memories.7: Starky is a secluded hot springs in Idaho with a large Olympic size pool and a great meadow with lots of shade to camp on. The pool is 14ft deep in the deep end by the diving board. At one time, there was a high dive. -Doug
Memories.8: The water from the hot springs is so hot that they have to shoot it out of a pipe into the air (like a giant 50' rooster tail) to cool it down. -Doug
Memories.9: We would strap an airline tow rope between two trees, hang a tire tube over the rope and strap somneone in with a belt. We would then pull back the rope with the person straped in and let go. It would act like a sling shot, but would oscilate back and forth. It would feel like getting shot out of the tube -Doug
Memories.10: ATV ride up the Cutty Mountain with all the guys -Byron

Memories.0: This was the way to see Lake Powell. We stayed in two of the largest houseboats on the lake. -Doug
Memories.1: One of my uncles put a bungee cord on the tube he pulled with his boat and we would get launched over the wakes -Morgan
Memories.2: 50 foot water slide into the lake -Katie
Memories.3: Jet skiing and riding boats along the beautiful red rock cliffs -Dana
Memories.4: I loved the slide they built for the kids to play on--such great fun going down the hill into the water. -Grandpa
Memories.5: The glorious scenery and on those luxurious boats with the slippery slide between them. -Grammy
Memories.6: We sailed out to a secluded cove and anchored there. -Doug
Memories.7: At the bottom of the water slide we built, there was a jump that you could get 5-6 feet of air before you went into the lake -Doug

Memories.1: I loved it when we had a giant bingo game! I loved watching everyone get super excited over silly prizes.-Lonni
Memories.2: So relaxing, everyone was happy hanging out next to the river -Byron
Memories.3: I loved the joy of having all our children and grandchildren together -Grammy
Memories.4: Canoeing around the island in the river with my cousins was probably my favorite part! -Derek
Memories.5: Going paddle boarding with my cousins Laurie and Leslie, The other side of the island looked like Hawaii! -Lonni
Memories.6: The food was excellent throught the entire trip! -Doug
Memories.7: Going to the fish hatchery was fun! We got to see some giant sturgeons! -Derek
